verses.verse: (Acts 19:33; 1 Tim. 1:20) Alexander the coppersmith did me much harm. May the Lord repay him according to his works.
You also must beware of him, for he has greatly resisted our words.
At my first defense no one stood with me, but all forsook me. (Acts 7:60; (1 Cor. 13:5)) May it not be charged against them.

The Lord Is Faithful (Deut. 31:6; Acts 23:11) But the Lord stood with me and strengthened me, (Acts 9:15; Phil. 1:12) so that the message might be preached fully through me, and that all the Gentiles might hear. Also I was delivered (1 Sam. 17:37; Ps. 22:21) out of the mouth of the lion.

(Ps. 121:7; (2 Pet. 2:9)) And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work and preserve me for His heavenly kingdom. (Rom. 11:36; Gal. 1:5; Heb. 13:21; 2 Pet. 3:18) To Him be glory forever and ever. Amen!
Come Before Winter Greet (Acts 18:2; Rom. 16:3) Prisca and Aquila, and the household of (2 Tim. 1:16) Onesiphorus.
(Acts 19:22; Rom. 16:23) Erastus stayed in Corinth, but (Acts 20:4; 21:29) Trophimus I have left in Miletus sick.
Do your utmost to come before winter. Eubulus greets you, as well as Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brethren.
Farewell The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.

Greeting Paul, a bondservant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect and (2 Tim. 2:25) the acknowledgment of the truth ((1 Tim. 3:16)) which accords with godliness,
in hope of eternal life which God, who (Num. 23:19) cannot lie, promised before time began,
but has in due time manifested His word through preaching, which was committed to me according to the commandment of God our Savior;
To (2 Cor. 2:13; 8:23; Gal. 2:3; 2 Tim. 4:10) Titus, a true son in our common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.
Qualified Elders For this reason I left you in Crete, that you should (1 Cor. 11:34) set in order the things that are lacking, and appoint elders in every city as I commanded you—
if a man is blameless, the husband of one wife, (1 Tim. 3:2-4; Titus 1:6-8) having faithful children not accused of dissipation or insubordination.
For a bishop must be blameless, as a steward of God, not self-willed, not quick-tempered, (Lev. 10:9) not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for money,
